snippet: Worried that directional fabric in broom pads makes redirecting the stone too easy, the World Curling Federation set new rules on the types of brooms that can be used.
abstract: World Curling Federation, worried that high-tech advances in broom pads are making sweeping too easy, sets severe restrictions on types of brooms that can be used; move ignites heated conflict as world's top curlers, many of whom have signed agreement not to use newest brooms, prepare for Olympic trials.
lead_paragraph: Worried that directional fabric in broom pads makes redirecting the stone too easy, the World Curling Federation set new rules on the types of brooms that can be used.

headline.main: Use of High-Tech Brooms Divides Low-Tech Sport of Curling
headline.print_headline: Some Curlers Seek to Push New Broom Aside
